node.title: The Peerless Imagination of Greg Tate
node.description: For four decades, he set the critical standard for elegantly intricate assessments of music, art, literature and more, writing dynamically about the resilience and paradoxes of Black creativity and life.

node.title: Biden Orders Federal Vehicles and Buildings to Use Renewable Energy by 2050
node.description: The federal government would stop buying gasoline-powered vehicles by 2035 and its buildings would be powered by wind, solar or other carbon-free electricity by 2050.

node.title: ‘Improvise It, Man.’ How to Make Magic Like the Beatles.
node.description: In a new documentary, ‘Get Back,’ the Beatles give a master class in creativity under pressure.

node.title: The Year America Lost Its Democracy
node.description: Republicans mounted an all-out assault on voting rights. Democrats did little to stop them.

node.title: Princess Amalia, Heir to Dutch Throne, Turns 18, Won't Accept $1.8M Yearly Allowance
node.description: Princess Amalia was sworn in to the Raad van State, the government's advisory group, in a ceremonial meeting on Wednesday.

node.title: GOP Rep. Peter Meijer Believes 'Real Threat' Is a Trump-Like Candidate but 'Better'
node.description: The Michigan congressman is also confident that Trump will win the GOP's nomination for the 2024 presidential election.

node.title: Man Allegedly Stabbed Girlfriend With 46-Inch Sword, Made Up Phony Burglary Story to 911
node.description: The victim, 31-year-old Mindy Singer, was dating the suspect at the time of the murder according to police.

node.title: Colorado Secretary of State Jena Griswold Asks for $200K for Guards, Protective Measures
node.description: Griswold's office says the money will be used for guards to protect Griswold and staff members at public events and to track the threats against her online.

node.title: Family Awarded $301 Billion From Bar That Overserved Drunk Driver In Largest Penalty Ever
node.description: Aujuni Tamay Anderson, 16, and her 59-year-old grandmother Tamra Kay Kindred were killed after Joshua Delbosque drove with a blood alcohol content of .263.

node.title: Scott Peterson Resentenced to Life in Prison Without Parole for Killing Pregnant Wife
node.description: "There are no words to express the pain associated with not being able to share our lives together," said Laci's brother Brent Rocha during the resentencing.

node.title: And Just Like That... a new chapter of Sex and the City begins. Here's everything you need to know about the reboot
node.description: It's been 17 years since we said goodbye to Carrie, Samantha, Miranda and Charlotte. Now, one of television’s most iconic series returns – and it could be just a revolutionary as the original.

node.title: Ali's glove, Bradman's bat and Schumacher's hat up for auction in Ipswich council sell-off
node.description: A disgraced former council used ratepayer funds to buy Muhammad Ali's gloves, Don Bradman's cricket bat and a trove of other sporting treasures. Now it's all up for grabs in a public auction.

node.title: Moth balls might remind you of your grandma's wardrobe — now they're propelling satellites into space
node.description: While moth balls may remind you of your grandmother's wardrobe, its key ingredient — napthalene — is being used to propel satellites in to space safely and efficiently.

node.title: When John's brother died of the flu, he became determined to be a doctor. Now he's set to be Chief Health Officer
node.description: On Monday, Dr John Gerrard steps into the role of Queensland's Chief Health Officer on a crucial day in the coronavirus pandemic when the state reopens its borders to fully vaccinated travellers from interstate hotspots.

node.title: Lifting welfare was a COVID-era experiment. Juanita is one of the people who want to make it permanent
node.description: Giving everyone a bit of money to live on could end up giving back a lot more to everyone in society, experts in basic income argue.

node.title: In just six days we've learnt plenty about where politics are heading
node.description: This year has been dominated by COVID-19 but, as the past six days show, the political landscape has been shifting in all sorts of ways that will shape the coming election, writes David Speers.

node.title: ‘Is There Still Sex in the City?’ Review: Candace Bushnell Dishes Hot Details
node.description: In her one-woman Off Broadway show, the “Sex and the City” author invites audiences behind the scenes of her life with a wink and a cocktail.

node.title: Coronavirus Cases Are Rising Among Children in South African Hospitals
node.description: The increase, observed in children’s wards at two major hospitals in South Africa, points to increased community transmission, doctors say.

node.title: Ally, Member or Partner? NATO’s Long Dilemma over Ukraine
node.description: NATO promised Ukraine full membership in 2008, but without explaining how or when. Putin sees that promise as an ongoing threat to Russia.

node.title: 'No customer, no business': This salon will be checking you're double vaxxed
node.description: After being "so safe for so long" the message that COVID is coming has been drilled into Tasmanians. So how are businesses gearing up for the influx of visitors when borders reopen next week?

node.title: Charges against only one former Lake Alice staff member 'not a satisfactory outcome'
node.description: The former patient says the decision to lay charges meant it finally felt as if survivors were listened to.

node.title: Emmett Till's Case is Closed, But DOJ Still Investigating Up to 20 Civil Rights-Era Deaths
node.description: "With the Justice Department's stamp on it, even a statement that the killings were wrongful would help even if there's no prosecutions," said John Hayes.

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell witness testifies he drove girls to Epstein home
node.description: A man has testified at Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal sex abuse trial on Wednesday that he drove teen girls to the Florida mansion of the late financier Jeffrey Epstein and saw them leave with hundred dollar bills.

node.title: Reuben Thorne and Mark Brown part ways with Canterbury rugby
node.description: Canterbury's NPC side are searching for a new head coach, with last season's co-coaches Reuben Thorne and Mark Brown moving on.

node.title: 39 soldiers to get Purple Hearts after CBS News investigation
node.description: The soldiers told CBS News they originally did not receive the award due to politics and felt pressure to downplay their injuries.

node.title: Kellogg's says it will permanently replace striking workers
node.description: Workers voted down a five-year offer from the cereal maker that included 3% raises and cost-of-living adjustments.

node.title: Four-day workweek gains traction among some in Congress
node.description: A bill to cap Americans' work week at 32 hours, and pay overtime above that, is an idea gaining popularity globally.

node.title: Fashion Tycoon Yusaku Maezawa Heads to International Space Station for 12-Day Adventure
node.description: Yusaku Maezawa paid to be a tourist at the International Space Station for 12 days. He took off for space with a list of 100 things he wants to do while there.

node.title: Over 35,000 Afghan Refugees Still Await U.S. Resettlement 4 Months After Evacuation Ended
node.description: Many refugees participating in Operation Allies Welcome want "to go to their new homes and start their new lives," but delays are lengthening the process.

node.title: The brightest comet of 2021 is hanging by a thread. Will it make it to Christmas?
node.description: Astronomers are anxiously watching the sky this week to see if a comet streaking through our Solar System will stay together long enough to be seen over Australia at Christmas.
